fields.headline: Miami Herald staff evacuated
fields.bodyText: Miami Police have evacuated the sixth floor of the Miami Herald building after an employee entered with a gun. The employee is reportedly identified as Jose Varela, formerly the cartoonist at El Nuevo Herald, the Spanish-language newspaper published by the Miami Herald Media company. Miami Police cleared the newsroom with Mr Varela reported to be inside the office of executive editor Humberto Castello. There were around 15 people in the newsroom when Mr Varela entered the building allegedly claiming to be a member of the armed forces. He is reported to have been carrying a hand gun by Miami Herald.com, but Sun Sentinel.com alleges he was carrying a machine gun. Miami police have surrounded the building. · To contact the MediaGuardian newsdesk email editor@mediatheguardian.com or phone 020 7239 9857. For all other inquiries please call the main Guardian switchboard on 020 7278 2332. · If you are writing a comment for publication, please mark clearly "for publication".
